title: 3 things to know as Tesla tops GM to lay claim as most valuable car company
text:
3 things to know as Tesla tops GM to lay claim as most valuable car company More

Tesla saw its shares jump 17 percent on Thursday, following a third quarter that put the Palo Alto-based electric car maker in the black. The strong showing for the stock on the Nasdaq exchange brought Tesla to a market capitalization of about $53 billion, lifting it above General Motors Co' $51 billion value. This isn't the first time Tesla has knocked GM from the top spot — it first achieved that milestone in April 2017 — but the larger, legacy Detroit carmaker soon reclaimed its No. 1 ranking.

The strong showing for the stock on the Nasdaq exchange brought Tesla to a market capitalization of about $53 billion, lifting it above General Motors Co' $51 billion value.  This isn't the first time Tesla has knocked GM from the top spot — it first achieved that milestone in April 2017 — but the larger, legacy Detroit carmaker soon reclaimed its No. 1 ranking.
